text: For anyone at SIAM CSE, what do you think to SIAM's new online platform? Do you actually get to talk to people? I'm wondering whether it's worth going to SIAM DS in May; I've been to quite a few badly done online conferences and getting frustrated with the experience (particularly after paying a sizeable registration fee!).

text: Not sure, but they were advertising it as a new platform with lots of networking opportunities

text: Ah right. A few I've been to recently used gather.town - i think it's works well

elements.text: Ah right. A few I've been to recently used gather.town - i think it's works well

text: Yes, I liked gather.town at the last JuliaCon

elements.text: Yes, I liked gather.town at the last JuliaCon

text:
I don't like it. The only online conference that I truly liked was JuliaCon. I'm not saying that because I was involved, in fact, I had no idea what to expect with the "conference experience" since I only did program committee. So I was blown away when I saw that web interface which was clean:

• 1 web page you go to
• 3 tabs that immediately show you the current videos
• Pooled chat rooms per track
Every other conference has gotten point 1 wrong: they require everyone figures out where to go. The conference should be 1 webpage, that's it. <http://live.myconference.com|live.myconference.com>, boom you're seeing the live feed of the talk with chat under it (maybe login for chat).

3 tabs that immediately show you the current videos
Every other conference has gotten point 1 wrong: they require everyone figures out where to go. The conference should be 1 webpage, that's it.
, boom you're seeing the live feed of the talk with chat under it (maybe login for chat).

text: I think the fact that the conferences are used for registration is what ruins them. That makes everyone want to block the content, and that just makes it hard to use. So I generally only watch the talks on Youtube now...

text: Yeah I did not like the SIAM CSE as well, very confusing

text: talks embedded in something like gather.town could be nice tho.... I just like "walking" around :wink:

text: For me the only main purpose of conferences now is to chat to people, so if they don't facilitate that then it isn't really worth it any more. There are so many great seminar sessions running online now, I can get all the scientific content I want without paying a penny. That's why I was hoping that SIAM's system was decent but it sounds like it isn't...
